hook.text: What if proposals passed automatically unless someone objected? That's optimistic governance â€” assume approval by default.

buildup.text: In optimistic governance, proposals go live after a waiting period. Members only act if they want to block something.

discovery.text: This reduces voter fatigue. Instead of voting on everything, members only engage when they disagree.

twist.text: The risk is that bad proposals sneak through when nobody is watching. Apathy becomes a vulnerability.

climax.text: Optimistic governance trades active participation for passive oversight. It works best with alert, engaged communities.

punchline.text: If nobody objects, it passes. Silence means yes.

quiz.question: How does optimistic governance work?
options: Proposals pass automatically unless someone raises an objection
